meanings.definition: The quality of being implied or understood without being directly stated.
meanings.sent1: Her implicitness in the matter made it clear she agreed with the plan.
meanings.sent2: The implicitness of his apology was evident in his tone of voice.
meanings.sent3: The implicitness of the joke took a moment for everyone to catch on.
meanings.sent4: The implicitness of the warning sign left many confused about its meaning.
meanings.sent5: The implicitness of the rule was so strong that no one dared to break it.

meanings.definition: The state of being implicit or inherent.
meanings.sent1: The implicitness of trust between them was unbreakable.
meanings.sent2: His implicitness in the family business was unquestionable.
meanings.sent3: The implicitness of the tradition brought a sense of comfort to the community.
meanings.sent4: The implicitness of her talent shone through in every performance.
meanings.sent5: The implicitness of the bond between them was palpable to all who knew them.
